title: ANDREW PIERCE: Storm warning over John Bercow's planned appearance on Irish TV chat show
text:
Speaker John Bercow has long since given up any pretence of the impartiality on Brexit that his office demands, writes ANDREW PIERCE

Speaker John Bercow — who was implausibly floated at the weekend as a potential caretaker Prime Minister — has long since given up any pretence of the impartiality on Brexit that his office demands.

His critics will now be even more infuriated by Bercow’s planned appearance on a TV chat show in Ireland just days before the crucial EU summit on October 17-18, when Boris hopes to get his latest Brexit proposal agreed.

Bercow is to be a guest on Friday on RTE’s The Late Late Show, one of the longest-running late-night talk shows on TV.

He astonished MPs last month by staging an impromptu press conference on College Green in Westminster after the Supreme Court ruling on the prorogation of Parliament — but this appearance on the Irish chat show at such a crucial time will be seen as even more inflammatory.

For Bercow will surely insist the vote by MPs taking a no-deal Brexit off the table is legally binding — and Johnson is bluffing when he says he can take us out.

The interview will be a gift for Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar who has rejected the new Johnson Brexit deal as unworkable.

One senior Government source said: ‘Bercow will have calculated that going on that programme will weaken our negotiating position. He’s a disgrace.’

n One of the vice presidents of the European Parliament, Heidi Hautala, was quick to dismiss the Johnson Brexit deal.

The Finnish Green MEP said: ‘It’s no good. It’s not a very serious proposal.’ Asked by Iain Dale on LBC if she had read the Prime Minister’s offer to the European Commission, she replied: ‘Err, no. But I am more or less aware of the proposals.’

Clearly not a very serious parliamentarian, then.

Fading soup-erstar

I-spy: Theresa May, who stayed away from the Tory conference, queuing alone for soup in Portcullis House in the Commons. In her Downing Street pomp she was always surrounded by a coterie of advisers.

Theresa May stayed away from this year's Conservative Party conference in Manchester

Radio 4 Today terrier John Humphrys said 'no' to appearing on BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing

Strictly? No cha-cha-chance

Doesn’t John Humphrys hanker to don sequins and delight the nation on the BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing?

‘I have been asked twice over the years, and the answer each time was “no”. The answer remains “no”,’ the former Radio 4 Today terrier asserts.

‘Poor old John Sergeant made a fool of himself. He’s a great mate of mine and, moreover, he turned making a fool of himself into a very successful career. So good on him, but it’s not for me.

‘Anyway, I’ve got two left feet.’

authors: Andrew Pierce For The Daily Mail
